Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Intravenous Preemptive Analgesia in Vitreoretinal Surgery

Participants.evidence: patients undergoing vitreoretinal surgery (VRS) under general anesthesia (GA)

Intervention.evidence: AoA-guided GA with IPA of 1 g paracetamol, 2.5 g metamizole, or both

Objective.evidence: This randomised controlled trial assessed the effect of intravenous preemptive analgesia (IPA)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of PONV, OCR, and OER within 24 hours postoperatively

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation used sealed envelopes, and allocation was concealed

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors and patients

Number_Randomised.evidence: 165 patients were randomly assigned... Data collection spanned January 2018 to December 2022

Number_Analysed.evidence: Of the 153 patients analyzed... The analysis was per-protocol

Result_Outcome.evidence: PONV occurred in 4%, OCR in 10%, and OER in 0%... The effect size for PONV was not significant between groups

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were minimal and similar across groups
